newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria's ATX index surges to record closing high.
newsitem.headline: Austria's ATX index surges to record closing high.

text.p: Austria's ATX index of 21 blue chips chalked up its biggest point gain in three years when it powered to an all-time closing high on Tuesday, the Vienna bourse said.
And analysts forecast the index has further room on the upside after it closed 30.17 points, or 2.3 percent, higher at 1,339.87.
Traders said buying was triggered after the index broke through resistance at 1,310 points soon after opening.
Investmentbank Austria sees the ATX's short-term target at 1,400 points on the condition that the schedule for the introduction of Europe's single currency is adhered to.
Winners overwhelmed decliners with 18 ATX shares advancing and three declining.
The day's best performer was luxury hosiery and lingerie maker Wolford, up 80 schillings at 1,270.
Creditanstalt preferred shares were the worst performers, losing 1.25 percent to 486.85 schillings.
Regional utility EVN the most actively traded, up 30 schillings at 1,610 on turnover of 104,097.
The broad-based Vienna bourse index advanced 8.07 points or 1.69 percent to 485.78 points.
The July ATX future gained 40 points to 1,347 on turnover of 1,915 contracts. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 531 12256
